item.title: First open-source contribution
item.description: Motivation First contribution to an open-source is the significant milestone in my journey as a software engineer, it’s a great way to learn and give back to the community. I’m currently working for Gridly, which is a content management and localization system. Gridly has a feature called Connector and it uses Airbyte internally for syncing data from other sources to Gridly. Airbyte Gridly connector So, I decided to write Gridly as a source connector to sync data to other destinations.

item.title: Start to blog
item.description: I am not proficient in language, including my native Vietnamse, so even after years of learning English, I am still struggling to master it. No, the above paragraph is not my orignial one. It’s the version from ChatGPT. And my second one as well. And … But they doesn’t matter though, what matters now is that I have decided to start to write a blog. And yes, you should probably know why.

item.title: Hire Me
item.description: Currently, I works as a full-time employee for Gridly. I’m not available for a new opportunity right now. But for my long-term plan, I would love to have a remote job. In case you have one and want to hire me, please check my Linkedin’s profile, and my cv.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I’m Tan Ho, I live in Ho Chi Minh city, Vietnam. My full name in vietnamese is Hồ Nhật Tân. I’m principal Software Engineer - Backend at Gridly. I’m also a husband, a father of one kid.
